title: Can't disable language filter
body:
Un-ticked it but it remains active in-game.
I followed the directions on older threads to disable it via the ingame files (Setting "EnableChatFilter" from 1 to 0.) but it's already a zero (and thus cant be changed)
Anybahdy got a fix?
Would be awesome <3

replies.body: Are you using the Beta Client or the Legacy Client? Try swapping over to the other client to disable it and let me know if it sticks!
Legacy client. Started happening after I made it re download a patch with the repair tool (was trying to fix latency issues)
Can you try swapping over to the Beta Client and let me know if the disable option works there?

Worked in the beta client,
And as stated in another comment, it fixes it in the legacy client to. (disabling it in the beta client)
Sure. Will have to wait till after uni doe.

Not sure if this has been resolved, but I got the same "bug" recently, and if you still have it, try this : 

Using both clients in turn, 
- go to your settings
- tick "enable language filter"
- Click done. 
- Go back to your settings
- Untick "enable language filter".

 Be sure to do it using both launchers.



As to why this happens I can only guess, but I would think that Riot created different setting files along with the different lobbies. It wouldn't affect out-of-game lobby since the launcher-specific would apply, but when you get in-game, the game now has two setting files to apply, botht he old and new one. 
I seems to behave as a "OR"; basically if either one of the launcher has a setting ticked, it is enabled. 

I hope it helped

Just tried.
Switched to the new client, ticked it off.
Switched back to the old client and YAY!
